column4: Is Ubuntu going to run significantly slower off a SD card vs a SSD hd?
Yeah.  It's taking forever to boot
dammit.. I have a 4 gig SSD but an 8 gig SD card
so I tried installing it on the SD card
since I kept running out of space
The SD card shouldn't be so slow that it takes like 10 minutes to boot though right?
It's a decent card, I think it's like a sandisk
i really wouldn't be surprised at all
vendor has very little to do with actual performance/speed/specs
well on a 4G drive, of course you keep running out of space
again that means pretty much nothing to ubuntu
I was answering your question of why someone might use less than 32g
uhh... not a very good answer?
it has a built in 4 gig hard drive, the only other storage is removable
ahh, well there ya go... can't complain much then, can ya :)
try something else then, like damn small linux and then install openbox or whatever
